title: Malus Peior Pessimus

replies.body:
Very good narrative with very few flaws. The two I picked up on might just be opinionated but I'm still going to comment on them. The first thing I didn't like was the part were she fought the High Commander. Two things bugged me about this. The less irritating was the verbal exchange between Katarina and the High Commander. The arrogance of Katarina's target even though he faced certain death seemed unrealistic, and it was difficult to pick up on the wounds he sustained during the fight. Maybe put more emphasis on those. The other flaw is the transition from killing to becoming High Commander. It seems Talon just disappeared and it was unclear where the second scene was set. 

The second mistake I found, is the lack of insight to the background of this story. Is Katarina attacking the Noxian High Commander, or a Demacian prince? Are Katarina and Talon from Demacia or Noxus? I just found it difficult to understand the reasons behind Katarina killing a High Commander when the High Commanders are from Noxus. Of course there is a power struggle, but the ball between Demacia and Noxus just makes it even more confusing. Please try and add some clarity to your story, maybe a bit of background knowledge.

Keep up the good writing!

My first draft ended up at 6781 words. The second was 4349. It took a lot of effort and time to cut this below 1500. I am used to writing chapters that are around 6000 - 9000 in length. I knew the limit would cause narrative and setting to fall behind, so I focused more on dialogue. Everything is explained via words. Because I cannot show you, I had to _tell_ you, which is a bad writing overall.

The fight had to be short because I neared the end and couldn't make it as showy as I originally had it. The exchange was rather important as it explained your questions. one, the title of High Commander is passed down by death. The killer usurps the rank, as is Noxian tradition. Katarina's father is a public figure and would lose face holding it. Katarina is not.

The former High Commander mocked her because Katarina is easy to distract and that was his attempt to flee. In the end, he realises he cannot and spurs her to end him. She reacts in anger, as he expected, and he is killed. Once again proving she's hot-headed and rash to act. Also, many people are arrogant before death. Call it a burst of stupidity or courage.

Talon vanished in his own attempt. It was assassin versus assassin and the story is focused on Katarina, so Talon got no screentime besides his initial presence.

You need to know Kat's lore for this story to make sense. Katarina and Talon are Noxian. The High Commander is Noxian. The Demacians were mentioned but never seen.

As the woman said before the High Commander was killed. The entire meeting was a farce. It was made to lure assassins out and kill them as they fled the city. Again, was explained in the original. The man's arrogance saved Katarina as she took an alternate way out of the city, avoiding all the traps and soldiers. She then reentered as a civilian and waited to claim her title.

Thank you for the comment, but do have a re-read and you'll see what I mean. :)
